## Expectation.toHaveBeenCalledExactlyWith() method

Checks the entire history of mock calls.

You can use matchers in place of a value. When a matcher is encountered its internal rules are used instead of the usual checks.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
toHaveBeenCalledExactlyWith(this: Expectation<Mock<any[], any>>, args: MockArgs<T>[]): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  this | [Expectation](./earljs.expectation.md)<!-- -->&lt;[Mock](./earljs.mock.md)<!-- -->&lt;any\[\], any&gt;&gt; |  |
|  args | MockArgs&lt;T&gt;\[\] | an array where each item is an array of values or matchers to check the mock call against. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
